events.message: The customer reported that their car was involved in a rear-end collision at a traffic light, causing noticeable damage to the rear bumper and trunk.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial details provided about the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case and to coordinate all further communication and investigations.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and provided the claimant with information regarding the next steps.
Request was made for the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and driver’s license for verification.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including pictures of the car’s damage and the official police accident report.
The claim investigation began with a review of the damages and circumstances surrounding the vehicle collision.
Investigation completed confirming the collision was the other driver’s fault and damage assessment was consistent with reported impact.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental vehicle reimbursement was proposed to the claimant for approval.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the proposed amount and the service.
The claim was officially approved based on the agreement reached after settlement negotiations.
Payment for the claim settlement was issued to the customer’s bank account covering all approved damages and expenses.
The claim was closed following successful payment and confirmation from the claimant that repairs have commenced.
All documents and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
